title: Teacher and security guard killed as boy allegedly opens fire at Serbian school
preview: A teacher and a security guard were killed when a boy allegedly opened fire in an elementary school in the Serbian capital Belgrade, the country’s government-owned news agency reported Wednesday.
repImgDesc: Police officers block the streets around the Vladislav Ribnikar school in Belgrade, Serbia after a teenage boy opened fire, causing injuries, early on Wednesday.

title: Over 100 arrested in anti-mafia raids across multiple European countries
preview: European police carried out raids in multiple European countries on early Wednesday, as part of a probe into the Calabrian Mafia, according to the Belgian federal prosecutor.
repImgDesc: A German police officer is pictured during a raid on Wednesday in North Rhine-Westphalia, Hagen.

title: Israel military strikes Gaza Strip in response to rocket barrage following hunger striker’s death
preview: Israel conducted strikes on the Gaza Strip late Tuesday after militants there fired rockets toward Israel following the death of a prominent Palestinian hunger striker in an Israeli prison.
repImgDesc: Israeli soldiers along the Gaza border on May 2, 2023.

title: Human remains found inside crocodile in Australia believed to belong to missing fisherman
preview: Remains found inside a crocodile in Australia are believed to belong to a 65-year old fisherman who went missing over the weekend, according to local police.
repImgDesc: Kevin Darmody was last seen fishing on the Kennedy River in Rinyirru (Lakefield) National Park in northeast Queensland.

title: Parts of a controversial anti-protest law come into force ahead of King Charles’ coronation
preview: Parts of a controversial public order bill, which empowers British police to take stronger action against peaceful protesters, will come into force on Wednesday, days ahead of the coronation of King Charles III.
repImgDesc: Protestors wait for the arrival of King Charles III and Camilla, the Queen Consort to visit Liverpool Central Library on April 26 in Liverpool, England.

title: American mountaineer dies during climb to Mount Everest
preview: A US climber has died on his way to scale Mount Everest on Monday, according to an expedition organizer.
repImgDesc: Mountaineers' tents are seen at Camp 2 of Mount Everest on May 8, 2021.

title: Man arrested outside Buckingham Palace days before King’s coronation
preview: London’s Metropolitan Police arrested a man outside Buckingham Palace on Tuesday after he allegedly threw suspected shotgun cartridges into the palace grounds, just days before the coronation of King Charles III.
repImgDesc: Security forces guard the gates of Buckingham Palace after police arrested a man outside Buckingham Palace for throwing what they believe were shotgun cartridges on May 2, 2023.

title: India’s top female wrestlers are camping on the streets of New Delhi. Here’s why
preview: The women wake just after dawn at the makeshift protest site, their belongings stacked under mosquito nets as a row of mattresses line the pavement in New Delhi.

title: Australia to ban recreational vaping in major crackdown on e-cigarettes as teen use soars
preview: The Australian government will ban e-cigarettes through a heavy set of controls on imports and packaging to discourage vaping, especially among teens, under its biggest smoking reforms in more than a decade.
repImgDesc: Teenage vaping has been linked to psychological issues, headaches, stomachaches and significant addictions to nicotine.

title: Venezuela’s Juan Guaidó seeks support in Washington after causing a stir in Colombia
preview: Venezuela’s former opposition leader Juan Guaidó is visiting Washington this week, where he hopes to meet with the Biden administration, he told reporters on Tuesday during a surprise appearance at the Washington Conference on the Americas.
repImgDesc: Juan Guaido speaks at the 53rd Annual Washington Conference on the Americas on May 2.

title: Leaders of Sudan’s warring factions agree to seven-day ceasefire, South Sudan says
preview: The Sudanese Armed Forces (SAF) and the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) – the two warring factions in Sudan – have agreed to a seven-day ceasefire, the foreign ministry of South Sudan said in a statement Tuesday.
repImgDesc: Former Horn of Africa EU Envoy: Sudan descending into 'civil war'

title: Religious leader linked to Kenya starvation case to face ‘possible terrorism charges’
preview: Paul Mackenzie Nthenge, the leader of a religious group linked to dozens of deaths in eastern Kenya, could face “possible terrorism charges,” according to his lawyer George Kariuki.
repImgDesc: Self-proclaimed pastor Paul Nthenge Mackenzie appears in court in Malindi on May 2, 2023.

title: Uganda lawmakers amend controversial anti-gay law but death penalty for HIV positive sex remains
preview: Uganda’s parliament has passed an amended version of the controversial Anti-Homosexuality Bill 2023 on Tuesday.
repImgDesc: Anti-homosexuality bills in East Africa worry LGBTQ citizens

title: Webb telescope detects mysterious water vapor in a nearby star system
preview: The James Webb Space Telescope has detected water vapor around a rocky exoplanet that orbits a star located 26 light-years away from Earth.
repImgDesc: This graphic shows the data collected by the Webb telescope as it observed GJ 486 b.

title: Slimmed-down royal family ‘doesn’t sound like a good idea,’ Princess Anne says
preview: King Charles III’s sister Princess Anne has said that a slimmed-down monarchy “doesn’t sound like a good idea.”
repImgDesc: Princess Anne is 16th in line to the throne but the second oldest of Queen Elizabeth II's four children.
